bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Pathological Condition of worms growing from the wounds of severed fingers. Rarely seen. Chuan xin shi yong fang Recipe book. Southern Song era, 1180. 傳信適用方 Last juan quotes Zhi qi ji fang 治奇疾方 : 手十指節斷壞，惟有筋連，無節，肉蟲出，如燈心 粗，長數尺。遍身綠毛卷多，名曰血餘。治以茯苓、胡黃連煎湯，飲兩 盞，愈 , “When the ten fingers have been severed so that there are no joints with only sinews connecting the individual parts, and when then worms appear as thick as a lamp wick, and several chi long, having curled green hair all over their body, then this is called ‘ blood surplus ’. One treats this with a decoction with fu ling and hu huang lian . If one drinks two small cups, this will bring the cure”.

② Pharmaceutical Substance of human hair pharmaceutically prepared for use as medication. Lei gong pao zhi lun 雷公炮炙論 Substance Entry yuan qing 芫蜻：去兩翅足並頭，用血餘裹懸於東牆角上一夜，至明取 用 , “Discard the two wings, the feet, and the head. Wrap in blood surplus and suspend above the edge of the eastern wall for one night. At dawn remove it and use it [for therapeutical purposes]”.
